title: Death Recap Update on PBE!
body:
https://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/9.2.1/img/champion/Sion.png

The death recap update is coming to PBE today and shipping to live in 9.14!

https://i.imgur.com/50N6GEW.jpg

https://i.imgur.com/alGo8GD.jpg


For those that haven't seen any of the conversation about the update, here are our core goals:

1. Help players quickly answer important questions about their death with an improved layout and visualization
     “What type of damage killed me?”
     “Which champs are the most threatening?”
     “Which spell do I really need to watch out for?”
2. Deliver reliable and accurate information about the damage sources and amounts


We're really excited to get this much needed improvement into the game (finally). Please leave us whatever feedback or bugs that you find in this thread.

Scruffy

replies.body: CC length should be split into perhaps ones that stun your movement completely and things like slows. Since those are the two main forms of CC someone would consider dealing with. (For example, if a majority of the CC is actually slows, people may consider Boots of Swiftness.)

The CC stat we are showing is actually roots, stuns +

Basically hard CC. In terms of "I died because of CC" we think that slows aren't nearly as big of a factor.
Tryndamere slow. Nasus slow.

> [{quoted}](name=Vrontis,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=kAGAwamn,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2019-07-01T20:25:35.936+0000)
>
> Tryndamere slow. Nasus slow.

Zilean falls under the radar, but he has a 99% slow that he can cast twice in quick succession.
He can Permaslow ppl if he wants to...
Y u u m i.
Are Blinds going to be in the CC stat? What about adding 80%+ Slows to the CC stat?

I personally think some slows are due for a tweak. While they may not affect a static teamfight much - 80%-99% slows like Nasus, Trynd, Zilean, Tahm K, etc can have a huge impact on the aftermath or pre-fight. They fly under the radar because hard cc is complained about most but 9/10 times I'd rather be hard CC'd than slowed on my way to or from the fight. I just think the slows in the game are due for a little more scrutiny and perhaps a duration/intensity decay.

Are you really certain people will change their build based on one death with a really specific scenario instead of pressing tab the whole game and seeing who's playing good and what their comp really is? I know it souns condescending and I'm sorry for that but stat you're asking for won't change your mind about builds you'll pursue. I like how rioter is getting visibly less upvotes even though he has so much more info on the subject and what not...
it's more so that the information is available to worse players. good players already know what to build but if you dont know corki's autos do magic dmg this tool would be super helpful.
Any chance there will be something indicating what actually killed you? Like, ''Lethal blow dealt by: Yasuo Q'' or something.
Why would that be relevant? You see what abilities damaged you and how much damage those abilities did to you. Why do you need to know the exact ability that finished you off?

What if you have 100 hp and die. But there was no enemy nearby?

Death blow: Warwick - Redbuff (12 true dmg) or Lux - Scorch (20 magic dmg)

but if you die out of  no where, and there's no enemies around you, after checking the damage that was dealt it would be easy to tell if it was red buff or ignite, most of the time this is obvious even if you didnt have this recapp. the only reason i could see this even being slightly usefull is if people wanted reasoning behind a death when their 100% sure it didnt happen.

example "wtf how did i fucking die? i wasnt ignited he didnt have red buff wtf, riot fix your shitty game"

vs now "wtf  how did i die i wasn......oh red buff was on me and i didnt pot, guess im not as good as i thought"

> [{quoted}](name=Mecha Minion,realm=EUNE,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=kAGAwamn,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2019-07-02T10:38:43.122+0000)
>
> Why would that be relevant? You see what abilities damaged you and how much damage those abilities did to you. Why do you need to know the exact ability that finished you off?

Why do I need a death recap if I don't want it? How do you turn shit crap off?
What is the amulett and the question mark in yasuo's damage recap? Are those items and runes or is there something missing?
We have a grouped up damage icon for "items" "runes" and "unknown" in the rare cases we are still unsure of the source.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=kAGAwamn,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-07-01T18:35:28.790+0000)
>
> We have a grouped up damage icon for "items" "runes" and "unknown" in the rare cases we are still unsure of the source.

I know this might not be your expertise but how can you not be sure about the source of the damage? Isn't death recap calculated server side?
Never underestimate the ability for a computer program to be weird.

Imagine a new champ is released, but the devs forget to update the death recap. "oops! I guess the game just crashes." 

It's generally a good programming idea to include a "miscellaneous" option, for cases where the program doesn't know exactly what to do. Especially when prototyping.

Riot reinboom talked in a reddit thread once and outlined the problems that came with updating death recap.

Basically the old death recap needed continued maintenance to be accurate. Will the new death recap need that as well or will it stay updated and accurate on its own so we don’t have flash dealing 2000 true damage?

They forgot to include this but according to a leak:

> Flash no longer deals 2000 true damage once in 8192 times. We know this was a nice addition to the game to make sure our Yasuos do not look that stupid when they flash in, but it's finally time to say goodbye.

/s

Can you make It bigger, like the store? And can you move it on the screen? 

Personally, It looks awesome ^^
You will have the ability to drag it around the screen.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=kAGAwamn,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-07-01T18:33:10.788+0000)
>
> You will have the ability to drag it around the screen.

good rework on death recap 
now can we rework client so my computer that runs modern AAA games on high can run the damn client as well

1. Will tower and minion damage still be shown?

2. It should be easy to see what the killing blow was, i.e. the final instance of damage that killed you. It'd really help in those cases where you flash out of a fight and then randomly fall over dead and you're not sure if it was a DoT, a minion attack, or an ability you didn't see coming.
Minion and tower damage is still included, yes.
https://media.giphy.com/media/FoH28ucxZFJZu/giphy.gif
RIP Infernal Drake with {{item:3087}}
It looks dope! We'll done

I know it's hard to implement, and probably a bigger feature, but it would be very nice, if you could get a replay of the last 10 seconds before you died, in order to quickly evaluate your mistakes, while waiting for the respawn timer anyway.

Probably better off using a third party software for this -> things like this already exist. A feature like this requires a large investment in time and resources which would require some research/analytics to support working on this feature.

So the rectangle in the first picture is gonna be on our screen 24/7 as long as we are dead? It is obstructing a large portion of the screen. Can we get the option to not have it on 24/7 and instead have the previous tiny rectangle that says "click for death recap" which immediately jumps us to the second picture without having to see the condensed rectangle shown in the first picture?

> [{quoted}](name=qKmSEverley,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=kAGAwamn,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2019-07-01T19:38:40.597+0000)
>
> So the rectangle in the first picture is gonna be on our screen 24/7 as long as we are dead? It is obstructing a large portion of the screen. Can we get the option to not have it on 24/7 and instead have the previous tiny rectangle that says "click for death recap" which immediately jumps us to the second picture without having to see the condensed rectangle shown in the first picture?

current death recap is permi on our screena and can be enlarged to see pointless information this is much smaller
@Riot: Please let me reopen death recap after I respawn! (Its own hotkey and UI button.)
Actually pretty good idea, especially early on when death duration is very short.
Would love to see damage from some of the runes like Scorch, Comet etc... Sometimes you die when you are nowhere close to an enemy champ, and its just hard to know why
they already show up in game lol just not always accurately
Will it tell us how many times we were hit by an ability (probably if we mouse over it)?
@Riot, Will there be a menu option to always start expanded?
Will self-inflicted damage such as health costs be listed? Ex. Ivern passive, Olaf E, and Soraka W?
Is it ok if i int to test the death recap? :D
https://youtu.be/pmw07nzRA3I

Just from those images I can say that there seems to be a lot of redundant info. You get damage distribution in 3 places: once as numbers, once as percentages, once as a pie chart. I think at least one of those can be cut, probably the percentages.
at least give us an option to disable the dam thing. i think it horrendous.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotScruffy,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=kAGAwamn,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-07-01T17:47:07.418+0000)

> 1. Help players quickly answer important questions about their death with an improved layout and visualization
>      “What type of damage killed me?”
>      “Which champs are the most threatening?”
>      “Which spell do I really need to watch out for?”
> 2. Deliver reliable and accurate information about the damage sources and amounts

> We're really excited to get this much needed improvement into the game (finally). Please leave us whatever feedback or bugs that you find in this thread.

Can I turn this garbage off? It's annoying....you can sprinkle in expletives to add how I really feel about it.

How come riot can release a new feature of something which has always been bugged as heck, even more bugged
I mean in my death recaps I see magic damage from my ally warwick, using tiger stance (udyr also in my team), and that not only once in the game...
Is it a 15 yo trainee who uploaded his programming test on prod servers or does riot actually not test their updates?????
Was it that glitched in pbe as well?
Do we have an ETA on patch 9.14 on main servers?

When are you going to fix the yasuo windwall bug, and its way often league disconnects when my internet is working fine in other apps, like im talking to my friends on discord but im disconnected in league, fix that please, and btw fix yasuo's W.
Itd be really nice if we could see the cooldown of abilities in the death recap or just straight up see the exact text the person casting them sees
